intro: Eleocharis erhaiensis, commonly known as the Erhai sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Erhai Lake region in Yunnan Province. The plant is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. Its botanical features include narrow leaves and tiny, wind-pollinated flowers arranged in dense clusters. Eleocharis erhaiensis plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
